curam.util.persistence.helper
Class BasePlusConcreteTableImpl<I,E extends Entity<I>,D extends DeepCloneable,C extends DeepCloneable>

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.persistence.helper.EntityImpl
      curam.util.persistence.helper.BasePlusConcreteTableImpl<I,E,D,C>
Type Parameters:
I - The identifier type used by the logical entity.
E - The concrete entity interface.
D - The generated Curam "dtls" struct which holds a row of data from the "base" physical database table.
C - The generated Curam "dtls" struct which holds a row of data from the "concrete" physical database table.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Entity<I>, EntityInfoSetter<I,E,C>, Insertable, Modifiable, MultipleTableEntity<I>, OptimisticLockable, OptimisticLockModifiable, OptimisticLockRemovable, Removable, Validator
public abstract class BasePlusConcreteTableImpl<I,E extends Entity<I>,D extends DeepCloneable,C extends DeepCloneable>
extends EntityImpl
implements MultipleTableEntity<I>, EntityInfoSetter<I,E,C>, Validator

Helper class for implementing a logical entity which is physically stored on:

  • a 'base' table and
  • a 'concrete' table
The base table may be "shared" by several concrete tables. Typically there will be two levels of implementation classes extending this helper class:
  • a single implementation of a "base" class, which should be marked abstract and be parameterized with the CONCRETE_ENTITY and CONCRETE_CLASS_DTLS_STRUCT; and
  • multiple implementations of "concrete" classes, which should extend the single "base" class.

getDiscriminatorValue

protected abstract java.lang.String getDiscriminatorValue()
Gets the discriminator value of the logical entity instance. Typically, the each implementation of a concrete class should implement this method to return a suitable discriminator value (typically from a code table). Concrete classes which do not supply discriminator value should return null. This null implementation can be supplied by the base class if required.

Returns:
TODO: JavaDoc.

getID

public I getID()
By default, assume that the id is supplied by the id of the base row. Implementations may override this method to supply the entity from elsewhere (e.g. a concrete row).

Specified by:
getID in interface Entity<I>
Returns:
the identifier of the base row.

getOptimisticLockRowManager

public RowManager<I,?> getOptimisticLockRowManager()
By default, assume that the base row manages the entity's version number (if any). Implementations may override this method to specify that another row (i.e. the concrete row) manages the entity's version number.

Specified by:
getOptimisticLockRowManager in interface MultipleTableEntity<I>
Returns:
the optimistic lock row manager.

insertRows

public void insertRows()
                throws InformationalException
By default, inserts the base row first (since it is assumed that the base row specifies or generates the entity's id), followed by the concrete row. A call is made to allow implementation to map the base row's key to the concrete row. Implementations may override this method to specify different processing when rows are inserted.

Specified by:
insertRows in interface MultipleTableEntity<I>
Throws:
InformationalException - TODO: JavaDoc.

mapBaseKeyToConcreteDtls

protected abstract void mapBaseKeyToConcreteDtls()
Maps the key from the base row to the concrete row. Implementations must supply a suitable mapping so that each concrete row refers to the base row. Typically this method is implemented on each "concrete" class.

modifyRows

public void modifyRows()
                throws InformationalException
By default, modifies the base row first , followed by the concrete row. Implementations may override this method to specify different processing when rows are modified.

Specified by:
modifyRows in interface MultipleTableEntity<I>
Throws:
InformationalException - TODO: JavaDoc.

removeRows

public void removeRows()
By default, removes the concrete row first (as it is assumed that there may be foreign key constraints from the concrete row to the base row), followed by the base row. Implementations may override this method to specify different processing when rows are removed.

Specified by:
removeRows in interface MultipleTableEntity<I>

setDiscriminator

protected abstract void setDiscriminator(java.lang.String value)
Sets the discriminator value in the field which discriminates between different concrete classes. Typically, the implementation of a base class which holds a discriminator value should override this method to set the appropriate member of BasePlusConcreteTableImpl.getBaseRowDtls() to the value supplied. Base classes which do not hold a discriminator value should do nothing.

Parameters:
value - The value of the discriminator.

setEntityInfo

public void setEntityInfo(EntityInfo<I,E,C> entityInfo)
